com.remote.remote2d.engine.entity

Class EntityList

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.remote.remote2d.engine.entity.EntityList

  • public class EntityList
extends java.lang.Object
    A big list of all of the Entities that are available. When spawning an Entity into the world, you need to add it to the entity list if you expect it to get tick()ed or render()ed.
    Author:
    Flafla2

    • Constructor Summary

      EntityList(Map map)
      Creates a new EntityList based on a parent map

                   int i)

        Parameters:
        e - Entity to add
        i - Index to add to

      • spawn

        public void spawn()
        Calls Entity.spawnEntityInWorld() for each Entity in the list, which in turn calls Component.onEntitySpawn() for each component.
        See Also:
        Component.onEntitySpawn()

      • set

        public void set(int i,
       Entity e)
        Sets the entity at the given index to the given entity. The higher the index, the later the Entity will be rendered, which means that an entity with a higher index will be "on top" of entities with a lower index. Also keep in mind that set() does NOT retain pointers to other entities. For this reason set() should almost ONLY be used by the engine. In almost all cases Entity.transpose(Entity) is recommended.
        Parameters:
        i - Index to set
        e - Entity to set at the given index

      • size

        public int size()
        Size of the list

      • indexOf

        public int indexOf(Entity e)
        The index of the given entity in the list
        Parameters:
        e - Entity to search for

      • get

        public Entity get(int index)
        Gets the entity at the given index. The higher the index, the later the Entity will be rendered, which means that an entity with a higher index will be "on top" of entities with a lower index.
        Parameters:
        index - Index to get from
        Returns:
        The Entity at the given index of the list.

      • getEntityWithUUID

        public Entity getEntityWithUUID(java.lang.String uuid)
        Searches the entity list for the given UUID. Equivalent to getEntityWithUUID(String, boolean) where mapLoad is false.
        Parameters:
        uuid - The UUID that is being searched for.
        Returns:
        An entity with the given UUID

      • getEntityWithUUID

        public Entity getEntityWithUUID(java.lang.String uuid,
                       boolean mapLoad)
        Searches the entity list for the given UUID.
        Parameters:
        uuid - The UUID that is being searched for.
        mapLoad - This is used by the map loader to automatically create new Entities when none can be found.
        Returns:
        An entity with the given UUID

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears the list completely

      • add

        public void add(java.lang.String uuidRep,
       Entity e)
        Adds the given entity just before the entity with the given UUID. Accounts for child entities.
        Parameters:
        uuidRep - UUID of the entity to add before
        e - Entity to add

      • instantiatePrefab

        public Entity instantiatePrefab(java.lang.String path,
                       int index)
        Instantiates the given prefab onto the entity list at the given index. In other words, it takes a saved file, loads it into the level, and adds it into the entity list.
        Parameters:
        path - Path to compiled entity data, in the form of a prefab file (The file must end in the filetype denoted by Entity.getExtension(), plus .xml or .bin at the end)
        index - The index at which you want to instantiate (insert) the entity.

      • instantiatePrefab

        public Entity instantiatePrefab(java.lang.String path)
        Instantiates the given prefab onto the entity list at the given index. In other words, it takes a saved file, loads it into the level, and adds it into the entity list.
        Parameters:
        path - Path to compiled entity data, in the form of a prefab file (The file must end in the filetype denoted by Entity.getExtension())
